comment.author: 92149915@N08
comment._content: Source: The National Archives Michael Anthony Ormus Biddulph DSC, RN was born on the 30th of January 1902 and his date of enrolment in the RN was the 15th of September 1915 at the tender age of 13. Source: U-Boat dot net Michael served in both the First and Second World Wars in the RN and was awarded the DSC on the 16th of August 1940. On the 23rd of January 1945, while serving on HMS Florizel as Acting Commander, he was mentioned in despatches. Michael was awarded the OBE on the 13th of June 1946. Source: Family Tree Maker Michael was the son of Harold Mavromichali Biddulph and Ethel Mary Edwards and died on the 28th of May 1966 at the age of 64.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: There is a record of Michael Biddulph's Second World War commands at uboat.net/allies/commanders/246.html . These are listed as: HMS NIGER as a Lt Cdr, a Minesweeper of 5th Flot, J 73, from 8 Nov 38 to 5 Oct 39 [HMS GLEN GOWER as an A/Cdr, a Minesweeper of 8th Flot, in Jun 40 to Jan 41. North Shields] HMS EXE as an A/Cdr, a Frigate, K 92, from 29 Sep 42 to 24 Nov 43 HMS ARIES, as an A/Cdr, a Minesweeper, J 284, from 1 (Dec) 43 to 25 Jul 44 HMS FLORIZEL, as an A/Cdr, a Minesweeper, J 404, from 5 Sep 44 to Dec 46 SS GLEN GOWER was a paddle boat, requisitioned as HMS GLENMORE as a paddle minesweeper (IWM picture at www.iwm.org.uk/collections/item/object/205121071 ). On 27 May 1940 she was involved in Operation DYNAMO, the evacuation of British and French troops from Dunkirk. It is probably for this action that Lt Cdr Michael Biddulph was awarded his DSC.//

comment.author: 32921850@N00
comment._content: His father's second name Mavromichali is interesting. Maybe he was named after Petro Mavromichalis (Πετρόμπεης Μαυρομιχάλης) (1765-1848) who fought against the Turks for Greek independence.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Photograph:  This photograph was taken by the famous society photographer Henry Walter Barnett, a Member of the Royal Photographic Society, probably at his studio at 12 Knightsbridge, Westminster, London. 

Walter Barnett was born at St Kilda, Victoria, Australia on 25 January 1862.  Aged 27 he married Hilda Frances Clement Forbes (b 1869 - aged 20) on 18 July 1889 in Sydney.  As an accomplished early photographer he emigrated to England and set up his first 'studio' off Hyde Park at 1 Park Side, Knightsbridge, in May 1898.  His business prospered and in 1901 he was a founder member of the Professional Photographers' Association.  This photograph would have been very expensive and is likely to be a portrait of Michael Biddulph aged 13 on becoming a Midshipman before joining his first ship.  Walter Barnett retired aged 58 to the South of France in 1920.  He died in Nice on 16th January 1934 aged 73.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Acting Commander of the minesweeper SS Glen Gower - it was the last ship to leave Malo beach June 2, 1940 during the evacuation of Dunkirk. books.google.ca/books?id=UqEOScq-AjUC&pg=PA101&lp...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Michael Anthony Ormus Biddulph: Educated at St Ronan's, West Worthing. Royal Naval College, Dartmouth. Commander, Royal Navy. Saw long service through WW2 - helped with the evacuation of Dunkirk. m. Elizabeth (Betty) Cooke: Marriage: 26 Nov 1926 Their children: Roger Biddulph. Simon Biddulph. Died 28 May 1966 Source: familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/g/r/e/David-W-Gregory... Father: Harold Mavromichali Biddulph (son of Michael A Shapnel Biddulph and Katherine) was born 26 Dec 1869 in Simla, India. Educated at Harrow. Lt Col in the Rifle Brigade, wounded during WW1. Occupation: 1901, Captain Rifle Brigade. Residence: 1901, 35 Whitehall Court, St Martins in The Fields, Strand, London. He married Ethel Mary Edwards in 1895 in Chelsea. Their children: Edith Biddulph. Michael Anthony Ormus Biddulph, d. 28 May 1966. Rosemary Biddulph. Rupert Biddulph, d. 21 Apr 1983, Reading. Robin Biddulph, b. 17 Apr 1909, d. 20 Mar 1986, Mortimer West End. David Francis Biddulph, b. Abt. 1913, d. Mar 1968.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: The family of Biddulph derive themselves from one Ormus de Guidon, lord of Darlaweston, who lived in or near the Conqueror's time, some of whose descendants assumed the name of Biddulph, from their residence at that village in the northern part of Staffordshire. www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=53781

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/32921850@N00] Michael Anthony Shrapnel Biddulph married in 1857 Katherine Stepan, daughter and co-heiress of Captain Stepan Stamati of Karani, Balaklava, commandant of Balaklava, by Helen, daughter and heiress of Paul Mavromichalis of Greece. Source: en.wikisource.org/wiki/Biddulph,_Michael_Anthony_Shrapnel... Grandfather Michael Anthony Shrapnel Biddulph 1823-1904 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Biddulph_%28British_Army_of...

comment.author: 98869051@N06
comment._content: My father served on board HMS Florizel June 44 to Apr 45. And have documents to prove it
